title: 105_hr2688
content: The "Economic Development Information Act of 1997" may be cited as the short title. The findings and declaration are outlined in the Act. Congress finds that accurate and timely information on economic development programs is crucial for maintaining the national economy and addressing unemployment and underemployment in various regions. Congress acknowledges the importance of providing accurate information on economic development programs to address unemployment and underemployment in different regions. Previous efforts by the Economic Development Administration have successfully assisted communities affected by military or Department of Energy installations closures or defense-related industries downsizing. Congress declares the need to expand economic development information to assist areas suffering from economic distress or deterioration, providing access to various resources in a useful format for economic development purposes. The Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965 is amended to include a new section establishing the Office of Economic Development Information. The Secretary will establish an Office of Economic Development Information within the Economic Development Administration. The Office will serve as a central information clearinghouse for economic development programs at the federal, state, and local levels, assisting applicants in locating and applying for assistance. The Office of Economic Development Information will assist in locating and applying for development assistance under Federal, State, and local laws, including financial and technical assistance. It will also develop electronic links to information databases to help agencies and entities identify and apply for resources under economic development programs. The Office of Economic Development Information will assist in identifying and applying for assistance and resources under economic development programs of the Federal, State, and local governments. Electronic links will be developed to provide relevant information on available economic development programs, including application process details and eligibility criteria. The Office of Economic Development Information provides assistance in applying for economic development programs at the Federal, State, and local levels. This includes information on application processes, eligibility criteria, contact personnel, economic data, and trends. The Office of Economic Development Information offers assistance for applying to economic development programs at various levels, including trade agreements, defense spending, technological change, and other sources of economic dislocation. It includes case studies, best practices, technology utilization programs, and information on revolving loan fund programs and finance programs related to economic development objectives. The Office of Economic Development Information provides resources for identifying sources of capital for businesses, understanding sustainable development, and accessing data services for public use. The Office of Economic Development Information ensures easy public access to its information clearinghouse through various means, including an Internet website with sorted key locations by economic development topics for users to access governmentwide and other resources. The Office of Economic Development Information provides easy public access to its information clearinghouse through various means, including a toll-free nationwide telephone number, online electronic access, printed manuals, periodic workshops, and on-call information specialists for person-to-person assistance. The Office of Economic Development Information offers public access to its information clearinghouse through various means, including on-call specialists for person-to-person assistance and coordination with other federal departments and agencies. This section also defines economic development and authorizes appropriations as necessary.
